Transfer the onion mixture to a small food processor. Blend until a partly pureed, partly chunky mixture is achieved. This blending step is optional.","5. Spread the blended onion mixture over the pizza crusts.","6. Distribute the cut grapes over the crusts as well, then transfer the pizza to the oven.","7. Bake on the center rack for 8 - 10 minutes***, or until the crust is golden.","8. Top with the sliced pears, arugula, \"feta\", a drizzle of balsamic vinegar reduction, and some toasted walnuts. Enjoy!"]
1394.title: Fruity Caramelized Onion & Feta Pizza

1395.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, chopped, 2cloves garlic, minced, 1½vegetable bouillon cubes, crushed, 3 Tbsp(19 g)roti masala seasoning†, 3medium potatoes, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1medium carrot, diced, 1cup(164 g)cooked chickpeas, 1cup(240 mL)canned crushed tomatoes, 1cup(240 mL)water, 1cup(240 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk (optional), 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, 1cup(134 g)frozen green peas, 2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 2large (25 cm) soft tortillas, cooked rice, fresh cilantro]
1395.recipe: ["1. To a large pot over high heat, add the oil and onions and cook for 3 - 4 minutes. Then add the garlic and cook for another minute.","2. Then add the crushed bouillon cube and masala seasoning. Cook and stir continuously for 30 - 60 seconds to allow the spices to lightly toast.","3. Add the potatoes, carrots, chickpeas, tomatoes, and water. Bring to a boil.","4. Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover, and cook for 20 - 25 minutes, or until the potatoes are fully cooked through. Stir periodically.","5. To make the garlic tortilla, mix the oil and garlic in a small bowl. Brush the garlic oil on each side of the tortilla and toast in a large pan on medium-high heat for 1 - 2 minutes on each side, or until golden.","6. When the potatoes are cooked, add the coconut milk, spinach, and peas. Cook until heated through.","7. Serve the curry with the toasted garlic tortillas 'naans', or some rice if desired. Enjoy!"]
1395.title: Potato & Spinach Curry

1396.ingredients: [3ripe bananas, mashed, ¾cup(180 mL)unsweetened almond milk, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)melted coconut oil, 1½cups(156 g)oat flour†, 1cup(116 g)chickpea flour†, ½cup(112 g)granulated sugar, 1 Tbsp(3 g)instant coffee granules, 2 tsp(7 g)baking powder, ¼ tspsalt, 2 tsp(9 g)granulated sugar, ¼ tspground cinnamon, 12raw pecans]
1396.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C), and lightly grease the wells of a muffin tin.","2. To a large bowl, add the bananas and mash until puréed. Then add the milk and oil and mix well.","3. Add the remaining muffin ingredients and mix until there are no lumps left. Fill the wells of the muffin tin until ¾ full.","4. In a small bowl, combine the sugar and cinnamon for the topping and sprinkle it on the muffins. Add a pecan to the top of each muffin.","5. Bake on the centre rack in the preheated oven for 16 - 18 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the muffin tins, and enjoy!"]
1396.title: Banana Coffee Muffins

1397.ingredients: [1cup(14 g)puffed rice, 1cup(240 mL)peanut butter, ½cup(38 g)toasted shredded coconut, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, or more if you like it sweeter, ½ tsppure vanilla extract, ¼ tspsalt, ¼cup(60 g)mini dark chocolate chips, unsweetened shredded coconut]
1397.recipe: ["1. To a large bowl, add the puffed rice, peanut butter, coconut, maple syrup, vanilla, and salt*. Mix. Add the chocolate chips, and mix again.","2. Using a tablespoon measure, scoop a large spoonful of dough into your hands and roll it into a ball**. Repeat with remaining dough until finished.","3. Optional step: roll the energy balls through extra toasted shredded coconut. Enjoy!"]
1397.title: Peanut Butter Cookie Dough Energy Balls

1398.ingredients: [1½cups(360 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk†, ½cup(112 g)granulated sugar, sweetened condensed milk iced coffee]
1398.recipe: ["1. Add the coconut milk and sugar to a heavy-bottomed* saucepan. Bring to a gentle boil over medium-high heat while stirring occasionally.","2. Turn the heat to low, and let the milk very gently simmer for 45 minutes. Be careful to not let it simmer too aggressively. Give it a stir every 5 - 10 minutes. The mixture should reduce in volume by about half in that time.","3. The condensed milk is ready when it has slightly thickened but is still pourable. When a spoon is dipped into the mixture, it should leave a thin layer on the spoon when the spoon is lifted out of the saucepan. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly.","4. Transfer the condensed coconut milk to a sterilized jar to fully cool off. Transfer to the fridge for at least one hour, it will thicken more in the fridge as it cools**. Enjoy!"]
1398.title: Vegan Sweetened Condensed Milk

1399.ingredients: [⅓cup(80 mL)brewed espresso, ¼cup(60 mL)sweetened condensed coconut milk, 2cups(222 g)ice cubes, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened oat milk]
1399.recipe: ["1. In a cup or glass, mix together the freshly brewed espresso with the condensed coconut milk. Stir together while the espresso is hot, so the condensed milk fully dissolves.","2. Divide the ice cubes and espresso mix between the glasses.","3. Top each drink with the oat milk, give it a stir, and enjoy!"]
1399.title: Sweetened Condensed Milk Iced Coffee

1400.ingredients: [1cup(240 mL)strong pour-over coffee, 3cups(720 mL)unsweetened coconut milk beverage, 2 tsp(10 mL)pure vanilla extract, ¼cup(60 mL)hot water, ¼cup(56 g)granulated sugar, 2 tsp(4 g)espresso powder]
1400.recipe: ["1. Pour the brewed coffee into an ice cube tray and freeze. In a pitcher, combine the coconut milk and vanilla. Store in the fridge until ready to use.","2. In a large bowl, add the water, sugar and espresso powder and whip with a electric hand mixer for 4 - 5 minutes or until soft peaks form. Alternatively, you could also whip it by hand using a whisk which will take about 8 - 12 minutes.","3. To serve, add the coffee ice cubes to a glass. Fill half the cup with the vanilla milk, and top the other half with whipped coffee*. Stir and enjoy."]
1400.title: Coconut Vanilla Iced Coffee with Coffee Whip

1401.ingredients: [2cups(162 g)rolled oats, ½cup(72 g)raw pumpkin seeds, ½cup(62 g)raw sunflower seeds, ½cup(58 g)raw walnuts, ½cup(54 g)raw pecans, ⅓cup(35 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, ¼cup(19 g)unsweetened shredded coconut, 2 Tbsp(21 g)whole chia seeds, ½ tspsalt, ½cup(120 mL)maple syrup, ¼cup(60 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract (optional), 1.7 oz(50 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, roughly chopped]
1401.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 340°F (170°C) and line a baking tray with a piece of parchment paper.","2. To a food processor, add the oats, pumpkin and sunflower seeds, walnuts, pecans, cocoa, coconut, chia seeds, and salt. Give it a few pulses to roughly chop the oats, seeds and nuts. If you don't have a food processor, you can also coarsely chop the nuts and seeds with a knife.","3. Remove the blade from the food processor. If the blades can't be removed, transfer the contents to a large bowl instead. Add the maple syrup, coconut oil, and vanilla and mix using a rubber spatula.","4. Transfer the mixture to the baking tray and spread it out evenly. Let the granola bake in the oven on the centre rack for 20 - 22 minutes, stirring halfway to ensure even baking.","5. Remove from the oven and allow the granola to cool completely. It will harden as it cools. Once completely cool, mix in the chocolate chunks, and enjoy with milk or yogurt and fresh fruit."]
1401.title: Double Chocolate Granola

1402.ingredients: [5.6 oz(160 g)firm tofu, drained, ¼cup(60 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp(1 g)nutritional yeast flakes, ½ tspsalt, ½ tsponion powder, ⅛ tspdried dill, ¼cup(60 mL)vegan mayonnaise, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)agave syrup, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)apple cider vinegar, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1 Tbsp(9 g)poppy seeds (optional) , ½ tspdijon mustard, ¼ tsponion powder, ¼ tspsalt, 6cups(180 g)fresh spinach, 1cup(150 g)fresh blueberries, 1medium shallot, thinly sliced, ½cup(58 g)roasted walnuts, chopped]
1402.recipe: ["1. Add all the \"feta\" ingredients to a small food processor and blend until creamy. Transfer to an airtight container and store in the fridge for at least 3 hours to harden*.","2. For the dressing, combine the ingredients in a small bowl.","3. To assemble the salad, add the spinach, blueberries and shallot to a large bowl. Drizzle over some dressing and toss to coat.","4. Top with a crumbling of the feta and the chopped walnuts. Serve with extra dressing and feta on the side. Enjoy!"]
1402.title: Spinach, Blueberry & "Feta" Salad

1403.ingredients: [11.4 oz(325 g)firm tofu, drained , ½cup(120 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)apple cider vinegar, 2 tsp(2 g)nutritional yeast flakes, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, ¼ tspdried dill]
1403.recipe: ["1. Add all of the ingredients to a blender and blend until creamy.","2. Transfer the mixture to an airtight container and store in the fridge for at least 3 hours, or ideally overnight. The longer it sits in the fridge, the more firm and crumbly the texture will become.","3. Crumble as desired over any dish, such as on salads. Enjoy!"]
1403.title: Incredible Vegan Feta

1404.ingredients: [½avocado, 1frozen banana, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened oat milk†, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy yogurt, 1cup(150 g)frozen blueberries†, ½cup(75 g)frozen pineapple chunks, 2cardamom pods, seeds only (optional) , ½ tsppure vanilla extract, ⅛ tspground cinnamon, hemp seeds, unsweetened shredded coconut]
1404.recipe: ["1. Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender and blend until smooth.","2. Pour the smoothie in tall glasses and top with desired garnish. Enjoy!"]
1404.title: Cardamom Avocado & Blueberry Smoothie

1405.ingredients: [2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, 1cup(150 g)frozen pineapple chunks, ¾cup(180 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, ½cup(52 g)frozen cucumber slices, ½avocado, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)pure vanilla extract, fresh berries, unsweetened shredded coconut, whole chia seeds]
1405.recipe: ["1. Add all of the smoothie ingredients to a blender.","2. Blend on high until everything smooth.","3. Pour into bowls and add desired toppings. Alternatively, pour into a glass and drink as is. Enjoy!"]
1405.title: The Extraordinary Green Smoothie Bowl

1406.ingredients: [3 Tbsp(26 g)all-purpose flour, 1½ Tbsp(21 g)granulated sugar, ¼ tspbaking powder, ⅛ tspground cinnamon, 1 pinchsalt, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, ¼ tsppure vanilla extract, 3 Tbsp(28 g)fresh blueberries, coconut whip, powdered sugar, vegan whipped cream]
1406.recipe: ["1. In a microwave-safe mug, mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.","2. Next add the milk, oil, and vanilla extract. Mix until just combined. Be careful not to over-mix. Then gently fold in the blueberries.","3. Microwave on high (800 - 900 W) for 2 minutes*, or until a toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean. If the cake isn't cooked through yet, place it back in the microwave at intervals of 15 seconds. Take care when removing it from the microwave, the mug might be hot.","4. Let the mug cake cool slightly, add your desired toppings, and enjoy!"]
1406.title: Vegan Blueberry Mug Cake

1407.ingredients: [3 Tbsp(26 g)all-purpose flour, 1½ Tbsp(21 g)granulated sugar, 2 tsp(7 g)rainbow sprinkles, ¼ tspbaking powder, 1 pinchsalt, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, ½ tsppure vanilla extract, coconut whip, rainbow sprinkles, vegan whipped cream]
1407.recipe: ["1. In a microwave-safe mug, combine the flour, sugar, sprinkles, baking powder, and salt. Then add in the milk, oil, and vanilla, and mix until just combined. Be careful not to over-mix.","2. Microwave on high (800 - 900 W) for 2 minutes*, or until a toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean. The cooking time may vary depending on your microwave and settings. If the cake isn't cooked through yet, simply place it back in the microwave at intervals of 15 seconds until done. The mug might be quite hot, so take care when removing it from the microwave.","3. Top with vegan whipped cream and sprinkles if desired, and enjoy!"]
1407.title: Vanilla Birthday Mug Cake

1408.ingredients: [⅓cup(50 g)frozen strawberries, ½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)cashew butter, 1lemon, juiced, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup, 1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, ½ tsppure vanilla extract, ⅓cup(80 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt, fresh strawberries, vegan granola]
1408.recipe: ["1. In a small bowl, microwave* the strawberries on high for 1 - 2 minutes. Mash the thawed strawberries with a fork, and let sit to cool slightly.","2. In a medium bowl, combine the oats, milk, cashew butter, lemon juice, maple syrup, flaxseeds, and vanilla.","3. Add the thawed berry mixture to the bottom of a mason jar or airtight container, then add the oat mixture on top of that. Seal the container, and let it sit overnight in the fridge.","4. The next morning, top with yogurt and other desired toppings, and enjoy!"]
1408.title: Strawberry Cheesecake Overnight Oats

1409.ingredients: [1apple, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)water, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup, ½ tspground cinnamon, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, ½cup(40 g)rolled oats, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(10 g)raisins, 1 Tbsp(10 g)whole chia seeds, 1 Tbsp(7 g)chopped roasted walnuts, ½ tspground cinnamon, ½ tsppure vanilla extract, ⅓cup(80 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt]
1409.recipe: ["1. Cut just over half of the apple into bite-sized cubes, and add these to a medium pan. Mince or grate the other half of the apple and add to a mason jar or airtight container.","2. To the pan, add the water, maple syrup, and cinnamon. Cook over medium-high heat, and allow the apples to soften for about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat and let cool.","3. Add all of the other ingredients to the jar, and mix to combine.  Add the cooked apple chunks to the top. Cover and let it sit overnight in the fridge. The next morning, top with yogurt and enjoy!"]
1409.title: Apple Pie Overnight Oats

1410.ingredients: [½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(7 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, ¼ tspalmond extract, ¼cup(65 g)cherry pie filling, ⅓cup(80 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt, chocolate shavings, fresh cherry]
1410.recipe: ["1. In a small bowl, mix the oats, milk, flaxseeds, almond butter, cocoa, and almond extract.","2. Spoon the mixture into a mason jar, alternating with spoonfuls of the cherry pie filling. Cover and place in the fridge overnight.","3. In the morning, top with yogurt and other desired toppings and enjoy!"]
1410.title: Black Forest Overnight Oats

1411.ingredients: [1cup(240 mL)peanut butter, 3soft Medjool dates, pits removed†, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ¼ tspsalt, 1¼cups(94 g)unsweetened shredded coconut, 5.2 oz(150 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, roasted peanuts, toasted coconut flakes]
1411.recipe: ["1. To a food processor*, add the peanut butter, dates, vanilla, and salt. Blend until smooth. Then remove the blade from the food processor and use a spoon to mix in the shredded coconut.","2. Scoop up a tablespoon of the mixture and roll it into a ball**. Transfer the rolled balls to a plate and place them in the fridge or freezer.","3. Meanwhile, melt the chocolate in a microwave or on a stovetop, using a double boiler. Let the chocolate cool off a little bit. Then line a baking tray or plate with parchment paper.","4. Take the peanut butter balls out of the fridge and use two forks to dip the balls into the chocolate to coat them completely. Let the excess chocolate drip off and transfer to the parchment paper.","5. If desired, sprinkle with a topping before the chocolate has hardened. Enjoy!"]
1411.title: Chocolate Coconut Peanut Butter Balls

1412.ingredients: [½cup(64 g)raw sesame seeds, ¼cup(36 g)raw pumpkin seeds, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, 1½ Tbsp(18 g)coconut sugar, ½ Tbsp(7 mL)melted coconut oil]
1412.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C) degrees. To a medium bowl, add all of the ingredients, mix well, then transfer the mixture to a lined baking tray.","2. Add another piece of parchment paper on top and roll it flat using a rolling pin. Use your fingers or the back of a spoon to tuck in the sides to create a rectangular shape.","3. Remove the top parchment paper, and bake in the middle rack of the oven for 18 - 20 minutes, or until lightly golden. When removed from the oven, let it cool completely. It will continue to harden as it cools. When cooled, slice the sesame slab into bite-sized squares. Enjoy!"]
1412.title: Crunchy Sesame Snaps

1413.ingredients: [⅓cup(76 g)margarine, ⅓cup(73 g)brown sugar, ⅓cup(80 mL)coconut cream†, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tsppure vanilla extract, 2cups(480 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1½ Tbsp(22 mL)apple cider vinegar, 3cups(414 g)all-purpose flour, 1½cups(336 g)granulated sugar, 1 Tbsp(10 g)baking powder, 1 tsp(5 g)baking soda, ½ tspsalt, ⅔cup(160 mL)melted refined coconut oil, at room temperature†, 1½ Tbsp(22 mL)pure vanilla extract, 7.9 oz(224 g)unsalted vegan butter, at room temperature , 2cups(268 g)powdered sugar, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, fresh berries]
1413.recipe: ["1. Start by making the caramel sauce. Add all the ingredients except for the vanilla to a saucepan. Stir continuously while bringing it to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, cooking uncovered for 8 - 10 minutes to allow the sauce to thicken. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.","2. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract. Allow the caramel sauce to sit and cool; it will continue to thicken as it cools, and thickens even more once refrigerated.","3. Grease two 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans with oil and line the bottom with a cut-out round piece of parchment paper. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).","4. To a medium bowl, add the milk and vinegar, and give it a mix. It'll start to curdle, creating vegan buttermilk.","5. Place a sieve over a large bowl, sift all the dry ingredients through it: the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix, and then create a shallow well in the middle.","6. Returning to the medium bowl, add the melted coconut oil and vanilla extract.","7. Add the wet ingredients to the large bowl with the dry ingredients, and mix until just combined.","8. Divide the batter between the two greased baking pans, and give the pans a gentle tap on the counter to release any air bubbles.","9. Bake the cakes on the middle rack of the preheated oven for 33 - 35 minutes, or until the edges are golden and a thin wooden skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.","10. Meanwhile, make the frosting by adding the butter to a large bowl. Use an electric electric hand mixer to mix the butter until fluffy, about 5 minutes.","11. Place a sieve over the bowl, sift in ½ cup of icing sugar at a time, and beat until it's all incorporated.","12. Add the vanilla extract and ¼ cup of the caramel sauce made in step #1 (reserve the remainder for garnish). Beat until combined.","13. When the cakes are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool for 10 minutes in the cake pan before transferring to a cooling rack to let them cool off completely.","14. If you like, you can level your cakes with a serrated knife to create a flat surface for stacking the cakes on top of each other.","15. Drizzle 2 Tbsp of caramel sauce on one of the cakes, and using a spatula or butter knife, spread out about 1 cup of frosting on it.","16. Place the second cake on top and drizzle with another 2 Tbsp of caramel sauce and frost with the leftover frosting. Smooth out the frosting on the top and sides of the cakes.","17. Optionally, spoon the leftover caramel sauce on top of the cake and let it drip down the sides. Top with some berries if desired and enjoy!"]
1413.title: Vanilla Caramel Cake

1414.ingredients: [3 Tbsp(23 g)roasted pistachios, minced , ¼cup(5 g)freeze dried raspberries, minced, 2 Tbsp(10 g)toasted coconut flakes, 2 Tbsp(25 g)candied pineapple pieces, 1 Tbsp(1 g)dried red rose petals, crushed (optional) , 2 tsp(7 g)hemp seeds, 14.1 oz(400 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, broken into pieces]
1414.recipe: ["1. Prepare and have at-the-ready your desired toppings: the pistachios, dried raspberries, coconut flakes, hemp seeds, candied pineapple, and rose petals. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.","2. Fill a saucepan one-quarter full with water, and bring to a gentle boil. Place a large heat-safe bowl on top of the pan and add the chocolate. The heat from the bowl will melt the chocolate. Stir throughout.","3. Once melted, remove the bowl from the stove (be careful as the bowl will be hot). Pour the melted chocolate onto the baking tray.","4. Use the back of a rubber spatula to spread the chocolate out into a thin layer, about ½ cm thick.","5. Sprinkle over top all of the toppings. Then use the back of a spoon to gently press down the pieces into the chocolate. Place the chocolate bark in the fridge for at least 1 hour to harden.","6. Once solid, let slightly soften at room temperature for a minute before cutting to avoid it snapping in other places. Cut into your desired shapes and sizes. Enjoy!"]
1414.title: Raspberry Rose Chocolate Bark

1415.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 13.2 oz(375 g)firm tofu, pressed, cut into 1 cm cubes, ¼ tspsalt, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1vegetable bouillon cube, 2cups(480 mL)cold water, 1cup(30 g)fresh spinach, packed, ⅓cup(8 g)fresh basil, packed, 6.3 oz(180 g)dry brown rice noodles, 1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 4cloves garlic, minced, 1medium shallot, finely chopped, 3 Tbsp(75 g)vegan Thai green curry paste, 1stalk of lemongrass, smashed (optional), 3dry kaffir lime leaves (optional), 1 tsp(2 g)freshly grated ginger (optional), 1bell pepper, thinly sliced, 1½cups(94 g)fresh snow peas, ½lime, juiced, chili flakes, fresh basil, fresh bean sprouts, lime slices]
1415.recipe: ["1. To make the tofu, add the oil to a large pan on medium-high heat. When hot, add the tofu cubes and sprinkle them with salt. Try not to disturb the tofu too much, only toss every couple of minutes, until golden on all sides, about 7 - 10 minutes.","2. To make the green broth, add the coconut milk, bouillon cube, water, spinach, and basil to a blender. Blend on high until smooth.","3. To a large bowl, add the rice noodles and pour boiling water over top to submerge. Drain after 2 minutes, once the noodles are al dente* and rinse under warm water. Divide the noodles into your bowls.","4. Once the tofu is golden and crispy on all sides, transfer to a bowl and set aside.","5. Return the same pan to heat and add the oil. When hot, add the garlic and shallots and cook until lightly golden, about 3 minutes.","6. Add the curry paste, lemongrass, kaffir leaves, and ginger. Sauté for a minute.","7. Add the bell pepper, and cook for an extra 3 minutes.","8. Add the snow peas and cook for only 30 seconds, before transferring the green blended broth to the pan. Allow this to come to a gentle simmer, and then remove from the heat once heated through.","9. Remove the lemongrass and kaffir leaves before serving.","10. Finally, squeeze in the lime juice, stir, and then ladle the broth over top of the noodles.","11. Add the tofu to the top of the bowl, and add any desired garnishes. Enjoy!"]
1415.title: Coconut Thai Green Curry Noodle Soup

1416.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(5 g)whole coriander seeds, 1 tsp(2 g)whole cumin seeds, 1 tsp(3 g)whole white peppercorns, ¼cup(4 g)fresh cilantro, 4green chili peppers, seeds removed, 5cloves garlic, 3stalks of lemongrass, 2medium shallots, roughly chopped, 1lime, zested, juiced†, 2 Tbsp(13 g)grated fresh galangal (also known as Thai ginger), 2 Tbsp(30 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 2 tsp(6 g)ground turmeric, ½ tspsalt, coconut Thai green curry noodle soup]
1416.recipe: ["1. In a small pan over medium-high, toast the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and white peppercorn for 4 - 5 minutes, stirring continuously. Toast until darkened and fragrant. Add to a grinder, or mortar and pestle, and crush the spices into a powder.","2. To a food processor, add all the ingredients and blend into a smooth paste. Enjoy in your favourite curry, or try it in our Coconut Thai Green Curry Noodle Soup recipe, for example!"]
1416.title: Vegan Thai Green Curry Paste

1417.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1 tsp(2 g)whole coriander seeds, ½ tspwhole cumin seeds, 1large onion, chopped, 4cloves garlic, minced, 2 tsp(4 g)freshly grated ginger, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, 1 tsp(2 g)garam masala, ½ tspground turmeric, ½ tspcayenne pepper, ¼ tspground black pepper, 4medium potatoes, cut into 2 cm cubes, 1cup(240 mL)boiling water, 1½cups(360 g)canned diced tomatoes, ½vegetable bouillon cube, crushed (optional), 1cup(134 g)frozen green peas, ½cup(120 mL)coconut cream†, cooked rice, naan]
1417.recipe: ["1. We'd recommend measuring the spices in advance to avoid burning them. Place the seeds separate from the powders in small bowls.","2. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the oil, coriander seeds, and cumin seeds. Cook the spices, stirring throughout, for 30 seconds - 1 minute.","3. Then add the onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring often.","4. Then add the salt, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne, and pepper. Cook for 1 - 2 minutes, stirring throughout.","5. Add the potatoes to the pot. Cook for 3 - 4 minutes, stirring frequently.","6. Pour in the water, tomatoes, and bouillon cube. Bring to a boil, reduce to a gentle simmer, cover, and let it simmer for 15 minutes.","7. Take the lid off, stir and cook uncovered for another 15 minutes. Then add the peas and coconut cream, and let heat through.","8. Serve with rice or naan, and enjoy!"]
1417.title: Aloo Matar

1418.ingredients: [½medium broccoli, 14.1 oz(400 g)dry shell pasta, 1½cups(224 g)cherry tomatoes, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, ¾cup+1 Tbsp(200 g)hummus, ½cup(65 g)raw cashews, 2 Tbsp(4 g)nutritional yeast flakes, ¼ tspgarlic powder (optional), ⅛ tspsalt, fresh basil]
1418.recipe: ["1. Cut the outer thick skin off the stem of the broccoli and discard. Cut the stem into little pieces. Cut the broccoli florets into bite-sized pieces.","2. Cook the pasta in salted boiling water for 4 - 5 minutes. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C).","3. Then add the chopped broccoli stem and florets to cook with the pasta. After 1 minute, drain. We want the pasta to be slightly under-cooked.","4. Transfer the drained pasta and broccoli to a large 11 x 8 inch (28 x 21 cm) baking dish, along with the tomatoes.","5. In a medium bowl, mix together the coconut milk and hummus. Pour this over the pasta and toss everything to coat. Bake in the centre rack of the preheated oven for 20 minutes.","6. Meanwhile, add the cashews, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, and salt to a small food processor*. Blend into a coarse powder.","7. If desired, although optional, add some of the cashew 'Parmesan' cheese to the top of the baked pasta and bake for an additional 3 - 5 minutes to toast.","8. Serve the pasta while hot, and sprinkle over top more vegan 'Parmesan' cheese. Enjoy!"]
1418.title: Creamy Hummus Pasta Bake

1419.ingredients: [6cups(1440 mL)boiling water, ½cup(90 g)dry chana dal, soaked overnight, drained , ½cup(104 g)dry mung beans, soaked overnight, drained , 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 2medium onions, chopped, 4cloves garlic, minced, 2 tsp(4 g)fresh ginger, minced, 1red hot chili, minced , 1 Tbsp(16 g)canned tomato paste, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander, 1 tsp(2 g)garam masala, ½ tspground turmeric, ½ tspsalt, 1medium tomato, chopped, 8cups(240 g)fresh spinach, divided, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, ½lemon, juiced, cooked rice, lemon slices, naan]
1419.recipe: ["1. Fill a large pot with boiling water and add the drained chana dal. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook uncovered for 20 minutes.","2. Then add the drained mung beans to the same pot and let it cook uncovered for another 15 minutes.","3. Heat a sauté pan over medium-high heat. Add the oil, onions, garlic, and ginger. Cook for 4 - 5 minutes.","4. Then add in the chili, tomato paste, and spices. Cook for 1 - 2 minutes.","5. Then add the chopped tomato and turn the heat to low.","6. Once the legumes are cooked, first remove ⅓ cup (80 mL) of the cooking liquid and transfer this to a blender. Then pour the legumes into a strainer to drain off the remaining liquid.","7. Place half of the spinach in the blender as well, and blend on high until smooth.","8. Add the blended spinach to the pan, together with the cooked chana dal, mung beans, and coconut milk.","9. Return the heat to medium-high. Meanwhile, chop the remaining half of the spinach. Add this to the pan, cooking until everything is heated through.","10. Just before serving, add in the lemon juice and stir. Enjoy!"]
1419.title: Green Spinach Coconut Curry

1420.ingredients: [⅓cup(76 g)margarine, ⅓cup(73 g)brown sugar, packed, ⅓cup(80 mL)coconut cream†, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tsppure vanilla extract]
1420.recipe: ["1. To a saucepan, add all the ingredients except for the vanilla. Stir continuously while you bring it to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, cooking uncovered for 8 - 10 minutes to allow the sauce to thicken. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.","2. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract. Allow the caramel sauce to sit and cool; it will continue to thicken as it cools, and thickens even more once refrigerated. Enjoy!"]
1420.title: Vegan Caramel Sauce

1421.ingredients: [2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, ¼cup(60 mL)water, 5.2 oz(150 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, broken into pieces†, 3 Tbsp(41 g)refined coconut oil†, ½cup(90 g)brown sugar, lightly packed, ⅓cup(43 g)roasted almonds, coarsely chopped, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 1cup(138 g)all-purpose flour†, ½ tspbaking powder, ½ tspsalt, flaked sea salt]
1421.recipe: ["1. In a small bowl, mix together the flaxseeds and water. Set aside.","2. Fill a saucepan halfway with water and bring to a boil. Place a large heat-safe bowl on top of the saucepan. Add the chocolate and coconut oil, mixing until it's all melted.","3. Then add the brown sugar and mix well. Remove the bowl from the saucepan. Be careful as the bowl will be hot.","4. To the same bowl, add the flaxseed mixture, almonds, and vanilla. Stir to combine.","5. Place a sieve over the bowl, and sift in the flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir until just combined, careful not to over-mix. Let the dough rest at room temperature for 15 minutes.","6. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.","7. Scoop up about 1½ Tbsp fo the dough and roll into little balls with your hands. The cookies don't spread much on their own, so place them on the baking tray and gently press the dough down to create little disks about 1 cm thick. Leave about 5 cm between each cookie on the tray.","8. To decorate, gently press a couple of small pieces of chopped chocolate and chopped almonds to the top of each cookie before baking in the oven for 10 - 11 minutes.","9. When the cookies are removed from the oven, sprinkle with some sea salt, if desired. Let cool on the baking tray for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Enjoy!"]
1421.title: Almond Brownie Cookies

1422.ingredients: [3cups(720 mL)barista oat milk, ½cup(120 mL)brewed espresso, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, ½ Tbsp(7 mL)blackstrap molasses†, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, ½ tspground ginger, 1 pinchground nutmeg, 1 pinchground cloves, coconut whip, crushed gingerbread cookies, vegan whipped cream]
1422.recipe: ["1. Add the barista milk to a saucepan on high heat. Whisk throughout to create some froth. Stay with it, as it often only needs a minute to heat through. When the milk starts to simmer, remove the pan from the heat and pour it into your desired mugs.","2. Return the saucepan to the stove on medium heat, and whisk together the espresso, maple syrup, molasses, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and clove. Let everything heat through.","3. Divide the espresso mixture between your mugs and top with whipped cream and cookie crumbles, if desired. Serve while hot, and enjoy!"]
1422.title: Vegan Gingerbread Latte

1423.ingredients: [⅔cup(151 g)margarine, ⅔cup(147 g)brown sugar, ½cup(112 g)granulated sugar, ⅓cup(80 mL)unsweetened applesauce, 1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 2 tsp(5 g)ground cinnamon, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 1 tsp(3 g)baking powder, 1 tsp(5 g)baking soda, ½ tspsalt, 2cups(276 g)all-purpose flour, 2cups(162 g)rolled oats, 1⅓cups(100 g)unsweetened shredded coconut, 1cup(109 g)raw pecans, chopped, ¾cup(126 g)dairy-free dark chocolate chips, coarse sea salt]
1423.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.","2. Add the margarine, brown sugar, and granulated sugar to a large bowl. Whip with an electric hand mixer or cream using a fork.","3. Add the applesauce, flaxseeds, cinnamon, vanilla, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Whip again, until everything is well combined.","4. Add the flour, oats, and shredded coconut. Gently fold these into the dough with a spoon until partially combined.","5. Fold in the pecans and chocolate chips. Stir again until just combined, but try not to over-mix.","6. Scoop up a ¼ cup of the dough and roll it into a ball. Then flatten to create a cookie that's about 1½ cm thick*.","7. Place the cookies on the prepared baking tray, leaving about 3 cm space between each cookie. If desired, press some chocolate chips or chopped pecans onto the top of each cookie before baking.","8. Bake in the centre rack of the oven for 12 - 14 minutes, or until lightly golden.","9. Let the cookies rest for a few minutes on the baking tray before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. Enjoy!"]
1423.title: One-Bowl Vegan Cowboy Cookies

1424.ingredients: [½cup(120 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk†, ¼cup(48 g)coconut sugar, ½ tspground cinnamon, 1½cups(360 mL)barista oat milk†, ⅛ tsppure vanilla extract (optional), ½cup(120 mL)brewed espresso, foamed milk, ground cinnamon]
1424.recipe: ["1. To a saucepan, add coconut milk, coconut sugar, and cinnamon. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, cooking uncovered for 5 minutes. Stir often to prevent it from burning.","2. When the coconut mixture has thickened and resembles a caramel sauce, add the milk and vanilla, and whisk to combine. Bring to a boil, then remove from the heat.","3. Brew the espresso into your desired cups*.","4. Pour the warm cinnamon coconut milk mixture overtop your espresso. Top with foamed milk and a sprinkle of cinnamon if desired. Enjoy!"]
1424.title: Cinnamon Coconut Cream Latte

1425.ingredients: [1½cups(285 g)uncooked brown rice, soaked overnight†, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned light coconut milk, 6cardamom pods, cracked (optional), 1vegetable bouillon cube, crushed , 1medium broccoli, cut into bite-sized pieces , 1medium onion, cut into bite-sized pieces , 2parsnips, cut into bite-sized pieces , 1½cups(297 g)cooked brown lentils, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)olive oil, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(3 g)garlic powder, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, ½ tspsalt, ½ tspground black pepper, ¼ tspcayenne pepper, ½lime, juiced, ⅓cup(80 mL)tahini, ¼cup(60 mL)water, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)sambal oelek, 2 tsp(10 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 2 tsp(10 mL)agave syrup, ½ tsponion powder, lime slices, medium carrot, red bell pepper, roasted almonds]
1425.recipe: ["1. To a medium pot, add the rice, coconut milk, cardamom, and bouillon. Stir, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook covered until the rice is tender and all the liquid has been absorbed about 15 - 20 minutes.","2. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C). To a parchment-lined baking tray, add the broccoli, onion, parsnip, lentils, oil, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper. Toss together, and spread out evenly.","3. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 20 minutes, stirring once halfway.","4. When cooked, remove the rice from heat. Fluff with a fork, remove the cardamom pods, cover with a lid, and let rest for 5 minutes.","5. Prepare the sauce by combining the lime juice, tahini, water, sambal, soy sauce, agave syrup, and onion powder in a mason jar. Shake or stir to combine into a smooth sauce.","6. To assemble, layer rice on the bottom of a bowl. Top with a generous heap of roasted vegetables and lentils. Add some (optional) fresh cut-up veggies of your choosing, drizzle the tahini sambal sauce on top, and enjoy!"]
1425.title: Coconut Roasted Lentil Nourish Bowl

1426.ingredients: [2½cups(202 g)rolled oats, 1cup(70 g)puffed quinoa, ½cup(72 g)raw almonds, coarsely chopped, ½cup(38 g)unsweetened shredded coconut, ½cup(72 g)roasted pumpkin seeds, ¼cup(45 g)brown sugar, ½ tspground cinnamon, ¼cup(60 mL)vegetable oil, ¼cup(60 mL)maple syrup, ¼cup(60 mL)almond butter, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ¾ tspsalt, 2 Tbsp(20 g)hemp seeds, ½cup(80 g)dried mango, thinly sliced]
1426.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 320°F (160°C). To a large bowl, add the oats, puffed quinoa, almonds, coconut, pumpkin seeds, brown sugar, and cinnamon, and give it a stir.","2. To a separate medium bowl, add the oil, syrup, almond butter, vanilla, and salt. Whisk until it's all combined into a smooth caramel-like sauce.","3. Pour this wet mix over the dry mix, and stir until coated.","4. Transfer to a large lined baking tray and spread it out. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 30 minutes, or until lightly golden, stopping stir once halfway.","5. Remove from the oven and allow it to cool. It continues to harden as it cools. Add the hemp seeds and dried mango, and toss.","6. When completely cooled, transfer the granola to a storage container. Enjoy with fruit, and yogurt or milk for breakfast, or as a snack!"]
1426.title: Crunchy Almond & Mango Granola

1427.ingredients: [2medium eggplants, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, 2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 3cloves garlic, minced, 2 tsp(6 g)ground cumin, 2 tsp(4 g)ground coriander, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, 1bell pepper, diced, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, 1cup(198 g)cooked brown lentils, ¼cup(32 g)dried apricots, diced, ½ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, ¾cup(180 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt, 5fresh mint leaves, thinly sliced, cooked rice, naan]
1427.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 390°F (200°C). Cut each eggplant in half lengthwise and cut cross-hatches into the flesh*. Sprinkle each side with ¼ tsp of oil and ¼ tsp salt and rub in.","2. Place the eggplant on a parchment-lined baking tray and bake for 20 minutes, until the eggplant can easily be pierced with a fork.","3. When fully roasted, remove from the oven, and when cool enough to handle, use a spoon to scrape out the cooked middle, discarding the skin. While the eggplant is roasting, prepare the curry.","4. Heat the oil in a large pot on medium-high heat. Sauté the onions until soft, about 3 - 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","5. Add the garlic, cumin, coriander, and cinnamon and sauté until fragrant, about a minute.","6. Add the bell pepper, tomatoes, lentils, apricots, salt, pepper, and roasted eggplant. Heat through until the bell peppers are soft but still crunchy.","7. To serve, we highly recommend garnishing it with coconut yogurt, mint, and lemon as the flavours really help to elevate the curry. Enjoy!"]
1427.title: Eggplant & Lentil Apricot Curry

1428.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 2 tsp(4 g)whole cumin seeds, 2 tsp(3 g)whole coriander seeds, 2 tsp(4 g)whole brown mustard seeds (optional), 1medium onion, diced, 3cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)freshly grated ginger, 1vegetable bouillon cube, crushed , 1 Tbsp(5 g)garam masala, 2 tsp(6 g)ground turmeric, ½ tspcayenne pepper, 3medium potatoes, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1½cups(360 mL)water, 1cup(134 g)frozen green peas, 1½cups(246 g)cooked chickpeas, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, cooked rice, fresh cilantro, lime slices, naan]
1428.recipe: ["1. To a large pot on medium-high heat, add the oil. When hot, add the cumin, coriander, and mustard seeds, stirring for 1 minute to toast the spices.","2. Then add the onion and cook for 3 - 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","3. Then add the garlic and ginger, and cook for 2 more minutes.","4. Add the bouillon cube, garam masala, turmeric, and cayenne, and cook while stirring for 30 - 60 seconds longer.","5. Add the potatoes and water. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes.","6. Then add the peas, chickpeas, and coconut milk. Cook until warmed through.","7. Finally, add the spinach, and when wilted, remove from the heat. Serve while hot and garnish as desired. Enjoy!"]
1428.title: Potato & Green Pea Curry

1429.ingredients: [15.8 oz(450 g)firm tofu, pressed, cut into 1 cm cubes , ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy yogurt, 2 tsp(3 g)garam masala, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander, ½ tspground turmeric, 1 pinchsalt, ¼cup(32 g)raw cashews, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 5cloves garlic, minced , 1large onion, chopped , 1jalapeño, seeds removed, minced , 2 tsp(4 g)freshly grated ginger, 1½ Tbsp(8 g)garam masala, 1½ Tbsp(9 g)ground coriander, 1½ Tbsp(13 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, ¼ tspcayenne pepper, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, ¼cup(66 g)canned tomato paste, ½ Tbsp(7 mL)agave syrup, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, cooked rice, fresh cilantro, naan]
1429.recipe: ["1. Soak the raw cashews in boiling water to soften. Set aside for 10 minutes. Preheat the oven to 400°F (205°C).","2. In a bowl, combine the tofu, yogurt, garam masala, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and salt.","3. Transfer the tofu onto a lined baking tray and bake for 15 - 20 minutes, stirring once or twice. Keep an eye on it to prevent burning.","4. To a large pot on medium-high heat, sauté the oil, garlic, onion, jalapeño, and ginger for 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","5. Add in the garam masala, coriander, cumin, salt, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1 more minute, stirring throughout to toast the spices.","6. Then add the drained cashews, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, agave syrup, and coconut milk. Blend everything using an immersion blender or transfer to a standing blender to blend until smooth. Let simmer on low, and cover with a lid.","7. Once the tofu is golden, remove it from the oven and add it to the pot. Give it a gentle stir and serve. Enjoy!"]
1429.title: Vegan Butter "Chicken" with Baked Tofu

1430.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 2medium onions, finely chopped, 4cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)fresh ginger, minced, 1red hot chili, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)curry powder, 2 tsp(6 g)ground turmeric, 1 tsp(2 g)garam masala, ½ tspsalt, 2cups(480 mL)boiling water, 1½cups(270 g)dry chana dal, soaked overnight†, 1vegetable bouillon cube, 1½cups(285 g)uncooked brown rice, soaked overnight, 2cups(480 mL)water, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1yellow bell pepper, chopped, 1red bell pepper, chopped, 1cup(180 g)cherry tomatoes, halved, chili flakes, fresh cilantro, lemon slices]
1430.recipe: ["1. Add oil to a large pot on high heat. When hot, add the onion and cook until lightly golden, about 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Then add the garlic, ginger, and chili pepper and sauté for 2 - 3 minutes more.","3. Drop the heat to medium, and add the curry powder, turmeric, garam masala, and salt, and stir continuously for 30 seconds to toast the spices.","4. Add the boiling water, drained chana dal, and bouillon. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and partially cover. Cook for 30 - 40 minutes, or until the dal is cooked through*, stirring periodically to avoid burning. Add a splash of water as needed.","5. Meanwhile, add the drained rice and water to a medium pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, partially cover with a lid, and cook for 20 minutes. Then remove from the heat and leave covered.","6. Taste test the dal. When fully cooked through, add the coconut milk and bell peppers, and cook uncovered for 10 more minutes.","7. Then add the cherry tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve the dal with the rice, and garnish as desired. Enjoy!"]
1430.title: Creamy Coconut Chana Dal

1431.ingredients: [2cups(162 g)rolled oats, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, ⅓cup(80 mL)unsweetened applesauce, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)melted refined coconut oil, plus extra for frying†, 2 tsp(5 g)ground cinnamon, 1 tsp(3 g)baking powder, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ½ tspsalt, any nut butter of choice, fresh fruit, maple syrup, roasted pistachios, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
1431.recipe: ["1. In a food processor, blend the oatmeal into a flour. Alternatively, use store-bought oatmeal flour.","2. Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.","3. Preheat a large pan on medium-high heat with the oil. When hot, spoon about ¼ cup of batter onto the pan for each pancake and cook for about 2 minutes.","4. When the bottom becomes golden, flip and cook for another 2 minutes, or until lightly golden.","5. For a more balanced breakfast, enjoy these pancakes with some creamy nut butter drizzled overtop, fresh fruit, and creamy plant-based yogurt."]
1431.title: Simple Oatmeal Pancakes

1432.ingredients: [1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 1 Tbsp(12 g)active yeast, 3cups(414 g)all-purpose flour, ¼cup(56 g)granulated sugar, 2 tsp(7 g)baking powder, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, ¼cup(60 mL)melted refined coconut oil, melted †, 1cup(220 g)brown sugar, packed, ½cup(54 g)raw pecans, chopped , 2 tsp(5 g)ground cinnamon, ¼cup(60 mL)melted refined coconut oil, ¼cup(60 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup, 1cup(134 g)powdered sugar, 3 Tbsp(43 g)margarine, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 1 tsp(5 mL)clear vanilla extract]
1432.recipe: ["1. Heat the milk in a saucepan until just steaming*. Do not let simmer! Remove the saucepan from the heat and sprinkle the yeast over the milk, swirl to combine, and let sit for 5 minutes.","2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.","3. When the yeast mixture is foamy, add to the flour mixture along with the melted coconut oil. Mix to form a dough, then cover and let rest for 1 hour.","4. In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, pecans, and cinnamon. Set aside. Lightly grease a baking dish.","5. Transfer the dough onto a floured surface and dust it with a bit more flour. Use a rolling pin to roll the dough into a ½ cm thick rectangle.","6. Spread the coconut oil across the rolled-out dough - it looks like a lot, and that's okay!","7. Sprinkle the brown sugar and pecan mixture evenly overtop the rolled-out dough.","8. With the longest edge of the rectangular dough closest to you, begin to roll the dough into what resembles a very long sushi roll.","9. Cut the rolled dough into 12 buns, about 1½ inches (3 cm) thick each. We did this by cutting the roll in half, then in half again, and then cutting each of those quarters into thirds.","10. Place each bun into the baking dish, then cover with a cloth and let rest for another hour.","11. While the buns are resting, mix the remaining milk with the maple syrup. Set aside.","12. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Bake buns in the centre rack of the oven for 10 minutes.","13. Remove from the oven to spoon the sweetened milk mixture over the buns. Return to the oven to bake for an additional 20 - 25 minutes, or until the tops of the buns are golden.","14. While the buns are baking, whisk together the icing ingredients using an electric hand mixer or whisk.","15. When the buns are removed from the oven, let cool slightly before drizzling the icing overtop. Enjoy!"]
1432.title: Ooey-Gooey Cinnamon Buns

1433.ingredients: [7digestive cookies†, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, 10.5 oz(300 g)silken tofu, 1lemon, zested, juiced , ⅓cup(80 mL)coconut cream†, 2 Tbsp(28 g)granulated sugar, 1 Tbsp(8 g)cornstarch, 2 tsp(10 mL)pure vanilla extract, fresh berries, lemon slices, stewed berries, toasted coconut flakes]
1433.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). In a small food processor, blend the cookies and coconut oil into a crumb. Alternatively, crush it all together using a fork if you don't have a food processor.","2. Pour the crust mixture into a 17-inch (18 cm) spring form pan. Use the flat bottom of a cup to press the crumbs into a crust*.","3. In a blender, combine the tofu, lemon zest and juice, coconut milk, sugar, cornstarch, and vanilla. Pour the mixture into the prepared crust.","4. Lightly tap the pan on a solid surface to get rid of any bubbles.","5. Bake in the centre rack of the oven for 25 - 30 minutes, until the edges are lightly golden and the topped is cracked**.","6. Let cool at room temp for 30 minutes, then transfer to the fridge for at least 3 hours to set. Best if it can be let to cool overnight, although not necessary.","7. Decorate with toppings just before servings. Enjoy!"]
1433.title: Coconut Lemon Custard Tart

1434.ingredients: [½cup(112 g)granulated sugar, ¼cup(60 mL)water, ½cup(120 mL)coconut cream†, 2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, ¼cup(60 mL)water, 1cup(227 g)margarine, ½ cup(112 g)granulated sugar, ½cup(110 g)brown sugar, packed, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 2cups(276 g)all-purpose flour, 1 tsp(3 g)baking powder, ½ tspsalt, 1.7 oz(50 g)dairy-free dark chocolate chips (reserve some for topping), vegan vanilla ice cream]
1434.recipe: ["1. To a saucepan on medium-high heat, dissolve the sugar in water and bring to a gentle boil.","2. Add the coconut cream. Continue to stir at a gentle boil until the mixture starts to thicken slightly, about 8 minutes. Then remove it from the heat; it will continue to thicken as it cools.","3. To a large bowl, add the flaxseeds and water, and mix. Let sit for 5 minutes to gel.","4. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). To the flaxseed mixture, add the margarine, sugars, and vanilla, and mash together using a fork.","5. Add in the flour, baking powder, salt, and chocolate chips, and mix until just combined. Careful not to overmix.","6. Spread ½ of the batter in a 10-inch (26 cm) cast iron skillet. Cover with ¼ cup caramel sauce, then dollop the remaining dough over the caramel and smooth out. Top with reserved chocolate for decoration.","7. Bake in the centre rack of the preheated oven for 30 - 35 minutes, or until the top is golden.","8. Best served warm from the oven. Top as desired. Enjoy!"]
1434.title: Chocolate Chip Caramel Skillet Cookie

1435.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 1medium onion, diced, 4cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)fresh ginger, minced , 1 Tbsp(6 g)curry powder, 2 tsp(4 g)ground coriander, 2 tsp(5 g)paprika powder, ⅛ tspcayenne pepper, 4cups(960 mL)low-sodium vegetable stock†, 2medium sweet potatoes, cut into small cubes, 1medium banana, cut into coins†, 1medium carrot, chopped, ½cup(120 mL)peanut butter, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, coconut cream, fresh cilantro, roasted peanuts]
1435.recipe: ["1. In a large pot over medium heat, add the oil, onions, garlic and ginger, cooking for about 3 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to prevent burning.","2. Add the spices, stirring to toast until fragrant, about 30 seconds.","3. Add the stock, sweet potatoes, banana, carrot, and peanut butter. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover with a lid, and cook until the sweet potatoes are cooked through, about 15 minutes.","4. Add the coconut milk, and blend using an immersion blender or standing blender. Heat through completely, and enjoy!"]
1435.title: Peanut Butter Curry Soup

1436.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)olive oil, 6cloves garlic, ½medium butternut squash, peeled, chopped into 2 cm cubes, seeds reserved, 2red bell peppers, cut into quarters, 2medium carrots, sliced into 2 cm pieces, 1jalapeño, seeds removed, cut in half, 1medium onion, cut into wedges, ½ tspground cumin, ½ tsppaprika powder, ½ tspsalt, plus more to taste , ½ tspground black pepper, 3cups(720 mL)low-sodium vegetable stock†, ¾cup(180 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, ¼ tspground cumin, ¼ tsppaprika powder, ¼ tspgarlic powder, ¼ tsponion powder, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, coconut cream]
1436.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Toss all the roasted vegetable ingredients together on a lined baking tray.","2. Spread out evenly, and bake for 30 minutes or until the squash and carrots can be easily pierced with a fork. Toss the vegetables once or twice while they are baking.","3. Meanwhile, clean off the butternut squash seeds.","4. Toss the seeds with oil and spices, and bake on another lined baking tray for 15 minutes, until slightly golden. Stir once halfway. Remove from the oven and allow to cool.","5. After the veggies have roasted, add them straight to a large pot on high heat along with the vegetable stock and coconut milk.","6. Blend using a immersion blender. Alternatively, it can be added to a standing blender in batches, and blended until smooth. Heat through and garnish with the seasoned seeds. Enjoy!"]
1436.title: Roasted Vegetable Harvest Soup

1437.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 2medium shallots, chopped, 6cloves garlic, minced, 1red hot chili, minced, 2vegetable bouillon cubes, 2cups(480 mL)water, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 2cups(140 g)button mushrooms, sliced, 2cups(172 g)oyster mushrooms, sliced, 14.1 oz(400 g)dry fusilli pasta, ¼cup(38 g)sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained, chopped, 2 Tbsp(4 g)nutritional yeast flakes, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 1 tsp(2 g)paprika powder, 1 pinchground black pepper, plus more to taste, 1 pinchsalt, plus more to taste, 4cups(120 g)fresh spinach, fresh basil, lemon slices]
1437.recipe: ["1. Add the oil to a large pot on high heat. When hot, add the shallots, garlic, and chili, and sauté until lightly golden, about 3 minutes, adding a splash of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","2. Add all of the remaining ingredients to the pot, except for the spinach, and bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer with the lid partially covered. Cook for 12 - 15 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent burning.","3. When the pasta is al dente, remove from the heat and add the spinach. Stir until the spinach is wilted.","4. Squeeze over some lemon juice and sprinkle on thinly sliced basil leaves if desired. Enjoy!"]
1437.title: One-Pot Creamy Mushroom Pasta

1438.ingredients: [1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1cup(240 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1 tsp(3 g)ground turmeric, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 2soft Medjool dates, pits removed, 1 pinchground black pepper, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup (optional), ¼cup(60 mL)brewed espresso (optional)]
1438.recipe: ["1. Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender* and blend on high until smooth.","2. Pour this mixture straight into a saucepan. If your blender isn't very powerful, or if you don't like small fibres to remain in your drink, strain the mixture first when pouring it into the saucepan.","3. Bring to a gentle simmer on medium-high heat, stirring throughout. Taste test and add maple syrup if you'd prefer the drink sweeter. When warmed through, remove from the heat.","4. To turn it into a turmeric latte, add some brewed espresso to your cups if desired. Pour the golden milk into the cups, and enjoy!"]
1438.title: Golden Milk

1439.ingredients: [¾cup(124 g)chopped mango, ½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened coconut milk beverage†, 1 Tbsp(10 g)whole chia seeds, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup (optional) , ½ tsppure vanilla extract, almond butter, mango, toasted coconut flakes, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
1439.recipe: ["1. Add all the ingredients to a mason jar or airtight container. Mix to combine.","2. Add a lid onto the container, and let sit overnight in the fridge.","3. The next morning, add your desired toppings and enjoy!"]
1439.title: Tropical Mango Coconut Overnight Oats

1440.ingredients: [½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)peanut butter, 1 Tbsp(10 g)whole chia seeds, ¼ tspground cinnamon, ½cup(75 g)frozen mixed berries, fresh berries, roasted peanuts, stewed berries, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
1440.recipe: ["1. Add the oats, milk, peanut butter, chia seeds, and cinnamon in a mason jar or airtight container. Mix to combine.","2. Then add the frozen berries, and gently mix again. Add a lid onto the container, and let sit overnight in the fridge.","3. The next morning, add your desired toppings and enjoy!"]
1440.title: Peanut Butter & Jelly Overnight Oats

1441.ingredients: [½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter,  1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 1 Tbsp(9 g)chopped dairy-free dark chocolate, chocolate shavings, fresh raspberries, medium banana, roasted almonds, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
1441.recipe: ["1. Combine all ingredients in a mason jar or airtight container and let sit overnight in the fridge.","2. The next morning, top with desired toppings. To make this a complete meal, add a handful of fresh fruit and/or plant-based yogurt to the top. Enjoy!"]
1441.title: Almond Chocolate Overnight Oats

1442.ingredients: [½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 1 Tbsp(7 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, 1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegan nutella, 1 Tbsp(9 g)chopped dairy-free dark chocolate, 1 pinchflaked sea salt (optional), almond butter, chocolate shavings, fresh strawberries, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
1442.recipe: ["1. Combine all the ingredients in a mason jar or airtight container and let sit overnight in the fridge.","2. The next morning, top with desired toppings. To make this a complete meal, top with some fresh fruit and plant-based yogurt. Enjoy!"]
1442.title: Vegan 'Nutella' Overnight Oats

1443.ingredients: [2cups(300 g)frozen mango chunks, 2cups(50 g)fresh spinach, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy yogurt†, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, fresh fruit, toasted coconut flakes, vegan granola]
1443.recipe: ["1. Add all of the ingredients to a high-speed blender and blend on high until smooth. Pour into tall glasses, or into bowls to sprinkle overtop your favourite toppings."]
1443.title: Mango Spinach Smoothie

1444.ingredients: [2frozen bananas, 1orange, peeled , 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1cup(25 g)fresh spinach, ½cup(75 g)frozen raspberries, ¼medium raw beet, peeled, quartered , ¼cup(60 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt, 1 Tbsp(6 g)fresh ginger, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)peanut butter, fresh berries, toasted coconut flakes, vegan granola]
1444.recipe: ["1. Combine all ingredients in a high-speed blender and blend on high until smooth.","2. Pour into bowls and top with desired toppings. Alternatively, pour into a tall bottle and take with you on-the-go!"]
1444.title: Immune Booster Smoothie

1445.ingredients: [1½frozen bananas, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened oat milk†, ½cup(75 g)frozen chopped zucchini, ¼cup(34 g)roasted cashews, 3soft Medjool dates, pits removed , 1 Tbsp(7 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)brewed espresso, ½ tsppure vanilla extract, chocolate shavings, fresh berries, medium banana, unsweetened shredded coconut, vegan granola]
1445.recipe: ["1. Combine all ingredients in a high-speed blender and blend on high until smooth.","2. Pour into bowls and top with desired toppings."]
1445.title: Mocha Smoothie

1446.ingredients: [1½cups(360 mL)unsweetened coconut milk beverage†, 1cup(150 g)frozen strawberries, 1cup(150 g)frozen raspberries, 1orange, peeled , 1medium carrot, coarsely chopped, 1medium raw beet, peeled, quartered , ½cup(75 g)frozen chopped zucchini, ½cup(68 g)roasted cashews]
1446.recipe: ["1. Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth. Serve and enjoy immediately."]
1446.title: Pink Sunrise Smoothie

1447.ingredients: [1⅓cups(320 mL)coconut cream†, 2 Tbsp(17 g)powdered sugar, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract (optional)]
1447.recipe: ["1. Place the coconut milk can upside-down in the refrigerator for at least 5 hours, but best if left in the fridge overnight to allow the liquid to separate from the fat. Refrigerate a large bowl together with the whisks of your electric hand mixer for at least 10 minutes to cool.","2. Gently turn the can back right-side-up, and open the can. Pour out the liquid layer on the top, and save this for a future smoothie or curry. Using a spoon, scoop out the solid white coconut fat into a large bowl.","3. Whip the coconut cream for 3 - 4 minutes.","4. Then add in the icing sugar and vanilla, and whip again for an additional minute.","5. Use the coconut whip to top brownies, fruit crumbles, watermelon pizza, or as a topping on your favourite hot chocolate*."]
1447.title: Coconut Whip

1448.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, finely chopped, 3cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)fresh ginger, minced , 2cups(328 g)cooked chickpeas, 2½cups(175 g)button mushrooms, thinly sliced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)curry powder, ½ tsppaprika powder, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1bell pepper, thinly sliced, 1 pinchsalt, 1 pinchground black pepper, 4cups(120 g)fresh spinach, 15cherry tomatoes, halved , cooked rice, lemon slices, naan]
1448.recipe: ["1. Add the oil, onion, garlic, and ginger to a large pot on high heat and sauté for 3 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Add the chickpeas and mushrooms to the pot and cook for 5 minutes.","3. Add the curry and paprika powder and sauté for one minute longer.","4. Add the coconut milk, bell peppers, salt and pepper, and cook for another 5 minutes.","5. Add the spinach and tomatoes at the end, and stir. When the spinach has wilted, remove from heat.","6. Serve and garnish as desired. Enjoy!"]
1448.title: Mushroom & Chickpea Coconut Curry

1449.ingredients: [¼cup(54 g)refined coconut oil†, 1cup(142 g)buckwheat flour, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk, ½cup(112 g)granulated sugar, 1 tsp(3 g)baking powder, 5rhubarb stalks, peeled, cut into 1 cm pieces, 2apples, cut into 2 cm pieces, ½ Tbsp(3 g)fresh ginger, minced (optional), ¼ tspground cinnamon, powdered sugar, vegan vanilla ice cream, vegan whipped cream]
1449.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Put the coconut oil into a 6 x 10 inch (15 x 25 cm) baking dish, and place on the centre rack of the oven to melt.","2. Meanwhile, mix the flour, soy milk, sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl.","3. In another bowl, combine the rhubarb, apples, ginger, and cinnamon.","4. As soon as the oil has melted, remove from the oven and pour the flour mixture into the dish. Do not mix!","5. On top of the flour batter, place the apple and rhubarb mix. Again, do not mix!","6. Place the baking dish back into the oven and cook for 40 minutes, or until the batter is golden, but springy to the touch.","7. Remove from the oven, let cool for a few minutes before enjoying with coconut whip, or a scoop of vegan ice cream!"]
1449.title: Apple, Ginger & Rhubarb Cobbler

1450.ingredients: [½watermelon, 1½cups(360 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt†, 1cup(150 g)fresh berries, fresh mint leaves, roasted pumpkin seeds, toasted coconut flakes]
1450.recipe: ["1. Wash the watermelon and cut into 1 inch (2 cm) thick rounds.","2. Top each round with a couple of scoops of yogurt, and spread it so that it almost reaches the rind.","3. Cut each pizza into slices.","4. Add fruits and other desired toppings. Enjoy!"]
1450.title: Watermelon Pizza

1451.ingredients: [1¼cups(162 g)roasted almonds, 3soft Medjool dates, pits removed, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)melted coconut oil, 2 Tbsp(18 g)buckwheat flour, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 3 Tbsp(21 g)ground flaxseeds, 6 Tbsp(90 mL)water, 1cup(130 g)roasted almonds, ½cup(112 g)granulated sugar, ½cup(114 g)margarine, ⅓cup(46 g)all-purpose flour, ½cup(62 g)fresh raspberries, 2rhubarb stalks, peeled, thinly sliced , powdered sugar]
1451.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven the 350°F (180°C). For the crust, combine the almonds, dates, coconut oil, buckwheat flour, and vanilla in a food processor. Blend into a crumb.","2. Transfer the mix to a parchment-lined tart 10 inch (22 cm) spring form pan. Press into the pan using your fingers*.","3. For the filling, mix the flaxseeds and water in a small bowl and set aside to gel.","4. In the now empty food processor, combine the almonds, sugar, margarine, and flour. Blend into a paste.","5. Add the flaxseed mixture and combine.","6. Pour this filling into the prepared crust and top with the raspberries and rhubarb.","7. Bake in the centre rack of the oven for 25 - 30 minutes, or until the crust starts to turn golden at the edges.","8. Remove from the oven, and let cool for a few minutes before serving. Dust with powdered sugar if desired, and enjoy!"]
1451.title: Almond Tart with Raspberries & Rhubarb

1452.ingredients: [6cups(900 g)mixed fresh berries, 1cup(81 g)rolled oats, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, 1 Tbsp(14 g)brown sugar, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, roasted pecans, unsweetened coconut yogurt, vegan vanilla ice cream]
1452.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). If using larger berries, such as strawberries, first slice*. Divide the fruit into ramekins, or place it into a large baking dish.","2. In a bowl, combine the oats, melted coconut oil, brown sugar, and cinnamon. Mix to combine, then spoon over the fruit.","3. Bake on the middle rack of the oven for 10 - 15 minutes, or until the juices are bubbly, the fruit is tender, and the oatmeal is golden.","4. Remove from oven, let cool for a few minutes before serving. Top with plant yogurt, vegan ice cream, or coconut whip. Enjoy!"]
1452.title: Baked Fruit Crumble - Three Ways

1453.ingredients: [1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, ½cup(120 mL)pineapple juice, ½lime, juiced , ¾cup(112 g)frozen raspberries]
1453.recipe: ["1. To a medium bowl, add the coconut milk, pineapple juice, and lime juice and mix.","2. Pour this mixture into popsicle molds until each well is about 80 - 90% full*. Place the mold into the freezer for 1 - 2 hours.","3. Meanwhile, heat the frozen raspberries in a small saucepan on the stove on medium-low heat for 3 - 5 minutes, or until fully thawed. Mash slightly to release some of the juices. Alternatively, the berries can also be thawed in the microwave. Set aside to let cool.","4. After the 1 - 2 hours is up, remove the mold from the freezer and spoon the raspberry mixture onto the popsicles.","5. Use a popsicle stick to gently push the raspberries into the popsicle to create a swirl pattern. Then carefully position the popsicle sticks in the center of the mold and return to the freezer*. Let the popsicles freeze completely.","6. When you want to remove a popsicle, run the bottom of the mold under hot water for a minute and twist each side to help release the popsicle. Enjoy!"]
1453.title: Tropical Coconut Popsicles

1454.ingredients: [2cups(380 g)soft Medjool dates, pits removed, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, ½cup(53 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)water, ½cup(55 g)roasted pecans, ⅓cup(50 g)chopped dairy-free dark chocolate, 1 pinchflaked sea salt (optional)]
1454.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). In a food processor, blend the dates, coconut oil, cocoa powder, and water until smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed. Alternatively, if you don't have a food processor, mash the dates with a fork and mix the ingredients in a bowl.","2. Add the roasted pecans, chocolate, and a pinch of salt. Blend again, but let some chunks of pecans and chocolate remain.","3. Transfer the mixture into a parchment-lined 9 x 9 inch (21 x 21 cm) baking dish, and spread evenly. Bake on the middle rack of the oven for 10 minutes. Alternatively, skip the baking and put them straight into the fridge for chewy no-bake brownies.","4. When removed from the oven, top with some more crushed pecans, chopped chocolate, and a sprinkle of sea salt if desired. Gently press these in to secure them.","5. Let cool before cutting. These brownies are fudgiest if kept in the fridge. Enjoy!"]
1454.title: Ultra Fudgy Sea Salt Caramel Brownies

1455.ingredients: [1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 3 Tbsp(21 g)ground flaxseeds, 1½cups(207 g)all-purpose flour, ⅔cup(149 g)granulated sugar, 1 Tbsp(9 g)poppy seeds, 1 tsp(3 g)baking powder, 1 tsp(2 g)orange zest†, ½ tspsalt, ½cup(120 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, ⅓cup(80 mL)blood orange juice†, ½ tsppure vanilla extract, 1¾cups(234 g)powdered sugar, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)blood orange juice†, 1 tsp(2 g)orange zest†, 1 pinchsalt]
1455.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Add the milk and flaxseed to a small bowl, mix, and let sit to thicken for 5 minutes.","2. In a medium bowl, mix the flour, sugar, poppy seeds, baking powder, orange zest, and salt.","3. Once combined, add all the remaining ingredients: the flaxseed mixture, coconut oil, orange juice, and vanilla. Stir until just combined, but try to not overmix.","4. Pour into a parchment-lined 12 x 5 inch (30 x 13 cm) loaf pan and bake in the centre rack of the oven for 40 - 45 minutes*, or until a toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean.","5. Meanwhile, make the icing by whisking all the icing ingredients in a small bowl until smooth.","6. When the loaf is out of the oven, let cool completely before drizzling the icing over top. Enjoy!"]
1455.title: Blood Orange Poppy Seed Loaf

1456.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 2 Tbsp(50 g)vegan Thai green curry paste, 1medium sweet potato, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1¼cups(205 g)cooked chickpeas, ½cup(120 mL)water†, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, cooked rice, naan]
1456.recipe: ["1. To a large pot on high heat, add the oil and onions, and cook until the onions are soft, about 3 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Add the garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.","3. Add the curry paste, and mash into the garlic and onion mixture until fragrant, about 30 seconds.","4. Then add the sweet potato, coconut milk, chickpeas, and water*.","5. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for 10 - 15 minutes, partially covered, until the sweet potatoes are cooked through.","6. Remove from heat and add the spinach, stirring to wilt.","7. Serve over rice or with naan, and enjoy!"]
1456.title: Thai Sweet Potato & Chickpea Green Curry

1457.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 11.4 oz(325 g)firm tofu, pressed, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 3cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)freshly grated ginger, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)Thai red curry paste†, 2½cups(600 mL)boiling water, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1vegetable bouillon cube, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 2 tsp(10 mL)sambal oelek (optional), 1red bell pepper, thinly sliced, 4.4 oz(125 g)dry brown rice noodles, 2small heads bok choy, ends trimmed , fresh basil, fresh bean sprouts, lime slices, sliced green onion]
1457.recipe: ["1. Add the coconut oil to a large pan on medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, add the tofu. Try to let sit undisturbed, stirring only every few minutes. Continue until lightly golden and crispy on all sides.","2. Meanwhile, to a large pot on high heat, add the oil, garlic, and ginger. Let cook for 2 minutes.","3. Add the curry paste and cook for 1 more minute, stirring throughout.","4. Then add the boiling water, coconut milk, bouillon cube, soy sauce, sambal, and bell pepper. Stir and partially cover. Let the soup simmer for 5 minutes.","5. Then add the noodles and greens and let simmer for 3 more minutes**.","6. Serve, add the tofu, and your desired garnish, and enjoy!"]
1457.title: Thai Red Curry Noodle Soup with Crispy Tofu

1458.ingredients: [1head cauliflower, cut into bite-sized pieces, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1 tsp(3 g)garlic powder, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, ½ tsppaprika powder, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 3cloves garlic, crushed, 1 Tbsp(6 g)curry powder, ½ Tbsp(2 g)garam masala, ½ Tbsp(5 g)ground turmeric, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, 10cherry tomatoes, halved (optional) , 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1¼cups(248 g)cooked brown lentils, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, cooked brown rice, naan]
1458.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 410°F (210°C). Toss the cauliflower with the oil and spices. Spread on a parchment-lined baking tray. Roast on the centre rack of the oven for 40 - 45 minutes, mixing once halfway.","2. Add the oil to a large pot on medium-high heat. When hot, add the onion and cook until lightly golden. Add splashes of water if needed to deglaze the pot.","3. Then add the garlic and all of the spices, and stir continuously to toast for 30 - 60 seconds.","4. Then add the can of tomatoes and sliced tomatoes. Allow to simmer for 5 minutes.","5. Finally, add the coconut milk, lentils, spinach, and roasted cauliflower, and mix until everything is heated through, about 5 minutes.","6. Serve and enjoy!"]
1458.title: Roasted Cauliflower Lentil Curry

1459.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 2medium onions, diced, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 2vegetable bouillon cubes, 1medium zucchini, chopped, 3red bell peppers, chopped (also known as paprikas), 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander, ¼cup(38 g)sun-dried bell pepper in oil, drained, 2cups(480 mL)water, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, croutons]
1459.recipe: ["1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onions and sauté until golden, about 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Add the garlic and bouillon cubes and stir until the cubes have dissolved and the garlic is fragrant, about 1 - 2 minutes.","3. Add the zucchini, bell peppers, coriander, and sun-dried paprika to the pot, and sauté for 4 - 5 minutes.","4. Add the water, and bring everything to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and partially cover with a lid. Cook for 10 - 15 minutes.","5. Add the coconut milk, let it heat through, then purée the soup with an immersion blender or standing blender until creamy. Serve, garnish, and enjoy!"]
1459.title: Creamy Coconut Paprika Zucchini Soup

1460.ingredients: [1cup(160 g)steel-cut oats, soaked overnight, drained, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned light coconut milk, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1medium banana, sliced , 1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, ½ tspground cinnamon, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 1cup(150 g)fresh fruit, 3 Tbsp(15 g)toasted coconut flakes, 3 Tbsp(21 g)roasted pecans]
1460.recipe: ["1. To a saucepan, add the oats, coconut milk, plant milk, banana, flaxseeds, and cinnamon. Bring to a boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and allow to cook for 15 minutes*, stirring occasionally.","2. Add more milk if a thinner consistency is preferred, or cook for another couple of minutes to thicken. Stir in the vanilla and remove it from the heat.","3. Add your favourite toppings, and enjoy!"]
1460.title: Nourishing Coconut Milk Oatmeal

1461.ingredients: [1cup(135 g)raw blanched hazelnuts, 2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, 6 Tbsp(90 mL)water, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, ½ tspsalt, 2½cups(202 g)rolled oats, divided, ¾cup(142 g)soft Medjool dates, pits removed, ½cup(120 mL)almond butter, ⅓cup(73 g)refined coconut oil, soft or melted†, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ½cup(80 g)dried cranberries, chopped, ¼cup(36 g)raw pumpkin seeds, ¼cup(27 g)raw pecans, 1.4 oz(40 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, chopped, dairy-free dark chocolate chips, dried cranberries, hemp seeds, unsweetened coconut flakes]
1461.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Spread the hazelnuts onto a baking tray and roast for 8 - 10 minutes, or until lightly golden, stirring once halfway.","2. To a small bowl, add the ground flaxseeds and water. Mix and let sit for 5 minutes to gel.","3. Line or lightly grease a 9 x 13 inch (18 x 27 cm) baking dish.","4. To the food processor, add the hazelnuts, cinnamon, salt, and half of the oats. Blend into a flour.","5. Transfer to a large bowl and add the remaining oats to the bowl as well.","6. Returning to the empty food processor, add the dates and blend until a paste is formed.","7. Then add the almond butter, coconut oil, vanilla extract, and gelled flaxseeds. Blend until well combined.","8. Transfer the sticky mixture from the food processor into the large bowl with the dry ingredients. Add the cranberries, pumpkin seeds, pecans, and chocolate to the bowl as well. Mix well.","9. Transfer the mixture to the baking dish, and press down firmly to smooth out the top. If desired, press on any of the optional toppings for decoration.","10. Bake on the centre rack of the oven until lightly golden, about 14 - 17 minutes.","11. Let cool completely, before cutting into bars."]
1461.title: Hazelnut Granola Breakfast Bars

1462.ingredients: [2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, 6 Tbsp(90 mL)water, ¾cup(80 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk, ⅓cup(80 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, ⅓cup(75 g)granulated sugar, ¼cup(60 mL)maple syrup, 1 tsp(3 g)baking powder, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, 1cup(138 g)all-purpose flour, 2.6 oz(75 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, coarsely chopped, fresh raspberries, vegan whipped cream]
1462.recipe: ["1. In a large bowl, mix the ground flaxseed and water. Let sit for 5 minutes to gel.","2. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C) and line or lightly grease an 11 x 7 inch (30 x 20 cm) baking dish.","3. To the bowl containing the flaxseed mixture, add the cocoa powder, milk, oil, sugar, maple syrup, baking powder, vanilla, and salt. Mix well.","4. Then add in the flour, stirring gently until just combined. Try to not overmix.","5. Lastly, fold in the chocolate chunks.","6. Pour into the baking dish and bake on the middle rack for 15 - 17 minutes, or until the top is firm to the touch, and a toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean.","7. Remove from the oven and let sit for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely*.","8. Top the brownies with the vegan whip cream or ice cream. Enjoy!"]
1462.title: Double Chocolate Brownies

1463.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, ½cup(96 g)popcorn kernels, 1 Tbsp(14 g)refined coconut oil, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)maple syrup, 2 tsp(10 mL)pure vanilla extract, ¼ tspbaking soda, ⅛ tspground cinnamon, 1 pinchsalt]
1463.recipe: ["1. Heat the coconut oil in a heavy-bottomed large pot on high heat. Add the popcorn kernels, stir, and cover. Shake the pan back and forth every 15 seconds to heat the kernels evenly. When you hear a pop, lower the heat to medium-high and let the popcorn kernels pop away while shaking almost continuously. When the popping slows, remove from heat and keep the lid on until the popping stops.","2. To make the caramel sauce, add the remaining coconut oil and maple syrup to a small pan on medium-high heat. Allow to gently simmer for 2 minutes, stirring throughout*. Then remove the pan from the heat, and stir in the vanilla, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.","3. Drizzle the caramel sauce over the popcorn and toss to coat. Spread out the popcorn onto parchment paper and let sit for 5 minutes to harden as it cools. Enjoy!"]
1463.title: Vegan Caramel Popcorn
